headline: Nike, Superdry and Lacoste ads banned over 'misleading' sustainability claims
summary: Ads for Nike, Superdry and Lacoste have been banned in the UK after regulators ruled they exaggerated environmental benefits and misled consumers.  The Advertising Standards Authority (ASA) said all three brands used terms such as "sustainable", "sustainable materials" and "sustainable style" without evidence to back up the claims.  In a Google ad in June, Nike promoted tennis polo shirts with "sustainable materials".

raw.headline: Nike, Superdry and Lacoste ads banned over 'misleading' sustainability claims
raw.summary: Ads for Nike, Superdry and Lacoste have been banned in the UK after regulators ruled they exaggerated environmental benefits and misled consumers.  The Advertising Standards Authority (ASA) said all three brands used terms such as "sustainable", "sustainable materials" and "sustainable style" without evidence to back up the claims.  In a Google ad in June, Nike promoted tennis polo shirts with "sustainable materials".

headline: Is Nike’s New Tech-Centric COO Structure Rewiring the Investment Case for NKE?
summary: NIKE, Inc. recently overhauled its senior leadership structure, appointing nearly 20-year company veteran Venkatesh Alagirisamy as EVP and Chief Operating Officer to oversee both technology and supply chain, while eliminating several executive roles to streamline decision-making and align operations more closely with athletes and the marketplace. This consolidation of technology, supply chain, and commercial oversight under fewer senior leaders is intended to integrate digital capabilities...

This consolidation of technology, supply chain, and commercial oversight under fewer senior leaders is intended to integrate digital capabilities...

headline: Nike, Superdry and Lacoste ads banned for exaggerating sustainability claims
summary: The Advertising Standards Authority said ads for all three brands used the term ‘sustainable’ without providing any evidence to support the claims.
